definition: to destroy/to spoil/to ruin/to injure/cruel/oppressive/savage/brutal/incomplete/disabled/to remain/to survive/remnant/surplus
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: Then came a bit of stubbed ground, once a wood.
sentences.chinese: 那麼再向那殘垣斷壁靠近一點，一旦一根圓木。

sentences.english: Time ruined the old building, leaving only fallen walls. (2)
sentences.chinese: 歲月使這座舊樓成爲廢墟，只剩下殘垣斷壁。

sentences.english: The rebels poured over the broken walls, and soon conquered the city.
sentences.chinese: 叛軍紛紛越過殘垣斷壁，很快佔領了這座城市。

sentences.english: A ruins, in the eyes of archaeologists is beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 一道殘垣斷壁，在考古家的眼裏是美的。

sentences.english: Everywhere are the collapsed buildings, such as death or injury to life, a bleak.
sentences.chinese: 所到之處，都是殘垣斷壁如死傷的生命，一片淒涼。

sentences.english: He gazed disconsolately at the ruins of his house.
sentences.chinese: 他憂傷地凝視着他家的殘垣斷壁。
